intro: Heterocentron mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican sedge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has slender, triangular stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters. It thrives in moist environments such as wetlands and marshy areas.
